facts.fact: The average American faces a retirement savings gap of $191,000
The average retirement age in the US is 64, but many workers plan to retire at 67
Social Security replaces about 40% of pre-retirement income for average earners
Roth IRA contributions are made with after-tax dollars, allowing tax-free growth and withdrawals in retirement
Required Minimum Distributions (RMDs) from traditional IRAs must begin at age 73
The annual 401(k) contribution limit for 2026 is $23,500 ($31,000 for those 50+)
Index Strategies offer a 0% floor - when the S&P 500 drops 30%, you lose 0% and compound from your full principal. This is Zero is Your Hero.
Policy loans from Index Strategies are generally tax-free under IRC Section 7702
Index Strategy cash value growth is linked to S&P 500 performance without direct market exposure - you participate in gains up to a cap, but never experience losses
